contentrichtext.text: {{other uses}} {{Infobox political party |name = Virtue Party |native_name = Fazilet Partisi |leader = İsmail Alptekin (1998-2001) |founder = Recai Kutan |slogan = | colorcode = red |founded = 1998 |dissolved = 2001 |predecessor = [[Welfare Party]] |headquarters = [[Ankara]] |ideology = [[Islamist]] <br> [[Milli Görüş]] |religion = [[Sunni Islam]] |symbol = |party_logo = [[File:Fazilet.jpg]] |country = Turkey }} '''Virtue Party''' ({{lang-tr|Fazilet Partisi}}, FP) was an [[Islamism|Islamist]] political party established in December 1998 in [[Turkey]]. It was found unconstitutional by the [[Constitutional Court of Turkey|Constitutional Court]] and then banned in June 2001 for violating the secularist articles of the [[Constitution of Turkey|Constitution]].<ref>Atacan 2005, 188.</ref> After the party's ban, the party MPs founded two sections of parties: reformist [[Justice and Development Party (Turkey)|Justice and Development Party]] (AKP) and traditionalist [[Felicity Party]] (SP). Founders of the Virtue Party were also active members of the [[National Order Party]] (MNP), [[National Salvation Party]] (MSP) and [[Welfare Party]] (RP). The Virtue Party was the first party in this tradition to have a genuine intra-party democracy in the nation. [[Merve Kavakçı]], the female elected as the MP who was banned from swearing her [[oath]] in [[Turkish Grand National Assembly]] because she wore a [[hijab|headscarf]], was a Virtue Party member. == Footnotes == {{reflist}} == References == * {{cite journal |last= Atacan |first= Fulya |year= 2005 |title= Explaining Religious Politics at the Crossroad: AKP-SP |journal= [[Turkish Studies]] |volume= 6 |issue= 2 |pages= 187–199 |doi= 10.1080/14683840500119510 }} {{Milli Görüş parties}} {{Historical parties in Turkey}} [[Category:Islamist parties in Turkey]] [[Category:Defunct political parties in Turkey]] [[Category:Banned Islamist parties]] [[Category:Political parties established in 1998]] [[Category:1998 establishments in Turkey]] [[Category:Political parties disestablished in 2001]] [[Category:2001 disestablishments in Turkey]] [[Category:Banned political parties of Turkey]] {{Turkey-party-stub}}
